The focus is on using environmentally clean methods and looking at the reasons
behind an assignment.

months ago he would have been playing football with his schoolmates, but now

articles.summary:
An estimated 28,000 lemurs, the world's most endangered primates, have been
illegally kept as pets in urban areas of Madagascar over the past three years,
possibly threatening conservation efforts and hastening the extinction of some
of lemur species.
articles.title: Endangered Madagascar lemurs illegally kept as pets may threaten species conservation and survival (Eurekalert)

articles.author: EcoWatch: None Given
articles.summary:
EcoWatch: Last year, it often seemed like we were fighting attacks on the
environment from all sides. But those of us pushing back against pollution and
climate change enjoyed some significant victories in 2014, including the
People’s Climate March in New York in September—said to be the largest
environmental march in history—the dimming prospects for drilling in the
Arctic, and of course, the fracking ban in New York state. 2015 is shaping up
to be a year of even bigger environmental battles, with a new...
articles.title: GOP Agenda Promises Worst Attack on Environmental Protections in Decades (climateark)

articles.author: Nadeen El Ajou
articles.summary:
Hamad Medical Corporation (HMC) has announced the opening of their new 10-bed
supportive and palliativecare unit (SPCU) at the National Center for Cancer
Care and Research (NCCCR). Hanan Al Kuwari PhD, HMC’s Managing Director, who
officially opened the unit, explained that this was a very important milestone
in the journey of transformation for cancer services. […]
articles.title: HMC opens dedicated supportive and palliative care unit at the National Center for Cancer Care and Research (AME )

articles.summary:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - To learn the secret behind aging gracefully, you may
want to check out the bowhead whale, the majestic denizen of the Arctic waters
that boasts a lifespan topping 200 years.
articles.title: How to age gracefully? Ask a bowhead whale (reuters)

articles.summary:
For the first time, scientists have developed a detailed explanation of how
white-nose syndrome is killing millions of bats in North America.
articles.title: New Details Emerge on Mystery Bat-Killer Disease (Discovery)

articles.summary:
Yesterday I started a new feature here at ImaGeo: Pic of the Day. Over the
next year, I'll be trying to post one image every day here. Today's
installment: The photograph above of a mixed conifer forest in Colorado's
Front Range mountains west of where I live near Boulder. I went snowshoeing
there today, and as you can probably make out, snow was coming down. No
blizzard. Just enough to make it peaceful and beautiful. You're looking at a
mix of lodgepole and limber pine. And I think th
articles.title: Pic of the Day: A High Elevation Pine Forest in the Snow (Discover Magazine)

articles.summary:
Rainshowers are a lot more dramatic if you imagine every drop is a tiny
asteroid imperiling miniature dinosaurs or sending little astronaut Ben
Afflecks into space. It turns out your fantasy wouldn't be that far off, aside
from that last part. Researchers have found startling similarities between
asteroid craters and the fleeting indentations left by raindrops on sand. At
the University of Minnesota, physicist Xiang Cheng and three undergraduate
students scrutinized what happens when a dr
articles.title: Raindrops Are like Tiny Asteroid Strikes (Discover Magazine)

articles.author: Matt Williams
articles.summary:
It's known as HIP 85605, one of two stars that make up a binary in the
Hercules constellation roughly 16 light years away. And if a recent research
paper produced by Dr. Coryn Bailer-Jones of the Max Planck Institute for
Astronomy in Heidelberg, Germany is correct, it is on a collision course with
our Solar […]
articles.title: Rogue Star HIP 85605 on Collision Course with our Solar System, but Earthlings Need Not Worry (Universe Today)
